questions.question: What are the names of the three metal-organic frameworks (MOFs) discussed in the text?
What method was used for the synthesis of the ligands H4L1, H4L2, and H4L3?
What is the significance of incorporating both exposed metal sites and accessible nitrogen-rich triazole units into the MOFs?
questions.answer: Incorporating both exposed metal sites and accessible nitrogen-rich triazole units into the MOFs significantly enhances their CO2-selective capture capabilities.

questions.question: True or False: The CO2 uptake capability increases from NTU-111 to NTU-113.
What was the method used to predict the performance of NTU-113 in post-combustion CO2 capture from a flue gas?
questions.answer: The performance was predicted by using the isotherms of pure CO2 and N2 to simulate breakthrough curves for a CO2/N2 mixture in NTU-113.

questions.question: What are the BET surface areas of NTU-111, NTU-112, and NTU-113?
questions.answer: The BET surface areas are 2450 m2/g for NTU-111, 2992 m2/g for NTU-112, and 3095 m2/g for NTU-113.

questions.question: How does the pore size distribution of NTU-111 compare to NTU-112 and NTU-113?
questions.answer: The pore size of NTU-111 is 8.9 Å, while those of NTU-112 and NTU-113 are 8.6 Å and 9.6 Å, respectively.

questions.question: True or False: The isosteric heats of adsorption (Qst) for CO2 capture are higher for NTU-113 compared to NTU-111 and NTU-112.
What feature of the MOFs contributes to their high CO2-selective uptake capability?
questions.answer: The incorporation of both exposed metal sites and accessible nitrogen-rich triazole units into the MOFs contributes to their high CO2-selective uptake capability.

questions.question: True or False: NTU-113 is considered a promising candidate for CO2/N2 separation due to its large difference in breakthrough time for CO2 and N2.
What are the CO2 uptake values at 273 K and 1 atm for NTU-111, NTU-112, and NTU-113?
questions.answer: The CO2 uptake values are 124.6 cm3/g for NTU-111, 158.5 cm3/g for NTU-112, and 166.8 cm3/g for NTU-113.

questions.question: How does the molecular simulation study contribute to understanding the CO2 adsorption mechanism in NTU-113?
questions.answer: The molecular simulation study, including radial distribution functions and simulation snapshots, provides evidence of strong interactions between CO2 and both exposed metal sites and nitrogen-rich moieties in NTU-113, explaining its high CO2-selective capture capability.

questions.question: True or False: The nitrogen uptake capabilities of NTU-111, NTU-112, and NTU-113 at 273 K and 1 atm are significantly higher than their CO2 uptake capabilities.
What is the role of the 'click' chemistry in the synthesis of the MOFs discussed?
questions.answer: The 'click' chemistry was utilized for the versatile extension of diisophthalate ligands to synthesize nitrogen-rich tetra-carboxylate ligands, which are crucial for assembling the MOFs.

questions.question: True or False: The breakthrough times for CO2 and N2 through a fixed bed packed with NTU-113 are similar, indicating low selectivity for CO2 capture.
